headline: Tater Tot Bake
description: A lickety-split version of that ever-popular standby, shepherd's pie. Seasoned ground beef and onions are sauteed, layered in a casserole with potatoes, topped with condensed cream of mushroom soup, sprinkled with cheese and baked.

video.description: This easy, satisfying version of shepherd's pie is a real crowd-pleaser.
video.name: Tater Tot Bake

name: Tater Tot Bake
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the ground beef with the onions. Drain excess fat, and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Spread the beef mixture evenly over the bottom of a 2 quart casserole dish. Arrange tater tots evenly over beef layer. In a small bowl, stir the soup into the milk until smooth; pour over tater tot and beef layers. Sprinkle Cheddar cheese evenly over the top.
Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes, until cheese is bubbly and slightly brown.

review.reviewBody: Love the recipe as-is, but the second time I made it I added some sausage with the ground beef and then topped each serving with homemade green chili with pork. Turned out fantastic.
It was good, put some granulated garlic in the hamburger meat and a little pepper.

I made it as published and the grandkids loved it and want it the next time they come. I used fine shredded cheese and baked it in a convection oven so the cheese was a little crisp and that put it over the top.
Came togather well, but just wasn't a hit. I enjoyed, but my picky eaters weren't up for seconds.

I wanted a more Shepard's Pie flavor, so I changed the following (although sometimes I make the recipe as is- it's good, too!) *Swapped milk for beef broth *Added a can of corn *1 Tablespoon of Worcestershire *1 Tablespoon Ketchup Baked at 375 degrees for 45 minutes

My kids liked it, next time i will add some bacon to give it some flavor and possibly add garlic. Also, spreading some cheese on top of beef under the tater tots prior to baking would improve this dish

Made this for dinner this evening. Read several reviewers who suggested a few changes, and I incorporated some of those. Added green pepper and fresh mushrooms to the onion in the ground beef. Placed french style green beans (I had them on hand) at the bottom of the baking dish, then ground beef/veggie mixture and poured the soup/milk over the top. Cheese next, then tater tots. YUMMY!
this was a easy quick dinner i did add some French's crispy fried onions on the top before baking and it was delish i will make this dish again
turned out great, added a can of corn also.
Terrible. Ground beef and mushy tater tots. Will not make this again.

I've made this quite a few times. It is a bit bland if you do it as stated, but this recipe is so great as a starter and so unforgiving. We use only ground venison, I cook it with diced onions. Season to our taste, lots of garlic powder added, salt and pepper. Cream of mushroom soup with a little bit of milk. Green beans layered on bottom. Add some fresh sliced mushrooms or canned button mushrooms with the meat mix. Then layer of cheddar or mozarella, then the tater tots on top.
This was an excellent recipe. I used the rounds instead of tots (same thing, different shape). I also put french fried onions on top. Will definitely make again. Sorry forgot to take photo
Love it!so easy to make.

A friend of mine, who grew up on the Pine Ridge reservation. Made a very similar version of this dish for me last month. Because I am somewhat of a food snob. I was very reluctant to want to make it. As it turned out, however, both my mom and I absolutely loved it. I agree with everything Mare had to say. And made it my own by adding 4 cups of frozen peas and carrots, 1 tablespoon of red pepper flakes and topped the tater tots with 8 ounces of shredded cheddar jack cheese.
Seems like it would indeed be bland as written, but I added about a teaspoon of minced garlic to the meat and sliced button mushrooms to the mushroom soup, and it was great!

My mom has been making this for 20 years now. We brown the beef and onion and spices put that Into a dish put cream of mushroom soup evenly over it then put tater tots over that put cheese on top and then put French fried onions on top once you have 5 mins left in the oven
I used 99% ground turkey, omitted the cheddar cheese, added lots of fresh mushrooms and sprinkled it with pepper instead. Turned out great!

I made this and it was excellent.I did made a few changes ...I used Accent and Mrs Dash in place of salt & pepper. I also baked the tater tots separately according to the directions on the bag and then added them over the ground beef and continued to follow the video's recipe .The next time I make this I may add corn as well.An absolute 5 stars!!
Did not make any changes made how it said to and it was really good
Added mushroom soup to meat beforehand
I added a few extra spices, my older kids were visiting. They love food spicy so I made a small dish for us and a larger spicy ( green chilies, cilantro and jalapenos ) for them. It was a big it.
Fan favorite in my house for years!

Disgusting...even sprucing up the beef (garlic, extra pepper, thyme) didn't matter once the soup goes on. The layering doesn't matter, this is a flawed recipe. A waste of perfectly good tots, not to mention beef...and time. Yuk.

We love this recipe! Easy to put together and easy to clean up. This recipe is the only reason I buy cream of mushroom soup and I don't really care for mushrooms. My family of four loves and we will continue to keep making it.
I recently made this recipe, but I made a few tweaks to it. I added a can of Rotel and a can of Cheddar Cheese soup. Everyone loved it!
Delicious
Amazing will be making it again!! My residents loved it.
I added chopped bacon and it was amazing! Family favorite!
Love this recipe! I used Campbell cheese instead of cream of mushroom Soup and added a couple of spoons of Greek yogurt. Mixed everything together. Topped with tater tots and cheese. Delicious!

This was yummy! I had no cream of mushroom soup so used cream of chicken instead. also when cooking the ground beef I had added epicure spices- herb and onion and garlic herb and when i layered the tater tots i also added those 2 spices also. I would make this again and if I do will add mix veggies to it.
Everyone loved it. I think I should’ve added brown gravy over the meat. I used mushrooms, frozen green beans and a bag of frozen peas and carrots

I used ground turkey, half an onion and 2 tablespoons of garlic. Added corn and homemade hot sauce as well. I used half a stick of butter to keep the turkey from drying out. I will use 1/4 next time to see how it comes out. Other seasoning was added for more flavor.
Everyone loved it!! Big hit.....will be making again!!

It's a good concept but fairly bland. I made it again and completely revamped it to add flavor and make it healthier. I used broccoli tots vs tater tots. Used ground turkey vs beef. Added riced cauliflower to meet for more veg. Added garlic and onion powder, salt, pepper. And a hearty amt of italian seasoning. Turned out great.

I made this a one pan dish by using my cast-iron skillet. I sautéed the beef and onion. Then I added the premixed milk and soup to the beef and mixed it all together. Next, I added a can of drained green beans on top followed by 2 cups of cheese. I topped it with hash browns. I baked it at 400° for 40 minutes.
Made this for my family and stuck it in the oven and went to church. Would have took a picture but when I got home it was all gone. They loved it.
I always add a can of corn and a can of the french style green beans in between the tater tots and the meat/onions
Taco and fajita seasoning and 1 can of stewed tomatoes, no soup
Added a bag of frozen mixed vegetables to hamburger and soup mixture, then layer shredded cheddar, top with tater tots and more cheese! Kids and adults love!!

Yum but I changed it up a lil..used cream of celery instead..not a fan of mushroom..

Also added a sprinkle of French fried onions over the cooked beef...

Family loved it!
Easy and taste great for simple dish.
I will make it again
So good! And easy! Tastes great the next day, too. Add a fried egg for a little extra yum!
Very easy to make. Our family loves mexican food so I added a package of taco seasoning and some green chilies. Turned out great!
This meal is quick, easy and delish!!!! We really enjoy this recipe.
Easy and tasty. I Put dill relish on top and added mustard too.
I made this for my husband, I followed the recipe exactly and he loved it!
Made it with half ground beef and half ground lamb, added a touch of curry and cumin, and added diced carrots and mushrooms. Great comfort dish.
This was a very good recipe. Fills up a 7 by 11 if made according to the directions. Could probably make it a little thinner in a 9 by 13.
excellent
A nice all in one casserole that my kids devoured! Quickly! :-)
Perfect comfort food and glad I used the tips from other reviews.
I doubled the recipe and added frozen peas and carrots.
I made this dish with my little six-year-old granddaughter was here very fast either and she absolutely loved it and so did My husband and me
Good
Easy! Fun! Simple! Delicious! My whole family loves it!! You can even top it with sour cream for more of a party in your mouth full of flavors!! It’s a family favorite hit now!

I added thawed frozen veggies and the tater tots I used had a seasoning on them already. I also cooked the meat in a cast iron pan. That way, after I drained the grease off, I was able to pop the whole thing in the oven and have one less dish to clean.

My parents enjoyed it. It was super easy to make and clean up
I added French’s Onions. It was re-sink!!

I have to admit not having high hopes for this recipe but it turned out really well! The only changes I made were no salt, I added a bit of chipotle pepper powder to the ground beef and onion while frying, and put the milk/mushroom soup mix on top of the beef. Was nice and easy to make.
Taste amazing and my kids loved it
Mare's suggestions were awesome, it's going on my weekly rotation. Thank you for posting this recipe!!
This is the one we make every time. Easy, and tastes great! We used ground turkey instead of ground beef, only because we switched years ago to eat less red meat.
Yes, my husband wants it again. I only used one-half pound of ground beef as there are only two of us. Even then it made two meals.

This was a family favourite as the kids were growing up and now it’s a favourite of the grandkids. Because we prefer it I’ve made a couple changes. First one kid won’t eat anything with onions so I skip them but if he’s not there I add onions with the cooking beef. I also don’t dilute the mushroom soup and I layer it all with tater tots on the bottom and end it with tater tots on the top. This makes the tater tots nice and. Risoy on the top. Try this recipe and your kids will thank you.
I have made this many times. Everybody loves it.If you want to make it spicier do it at the table. easily done.
My Kids LOVE IT!!!
I added turkey instead of beef and used condensed chicken and mushroom soup. It was yummy!
my family loved it. I added half cup of frozen green peas and 4oz can of mushrooms. It's very quick prep if you use frozen cooked ground beef (thawed).
Good old-fashioned midwestern comfort food. It's not fancy, and you can go a million different ways personalizing it, but it's pretty great as written too.
Awesome. Followed the other comments regarding layering tots on top!

A family favorite! I added a little bit of garlic powder to the ground beef along with salt and pepper. I also added a big spoonful of sour cream to the mixture just because that's the way my mother used to make it. I also put ground beef in my casserole dish first, then added the mixture over the ground beef. I topped it off with the tater tots and cheese on top just to give it a crispy topping! Quick and easy casserole that everyone enjoys and it was one of my childhood favorites!
Excellent quick meal for the family. easy to cook.

I cooked the ground beef with salt, pepper, granulated garlic and Italian seasoning. Then, I added the chopped onion and cooked them until tender. To that, I added half of a can of Del Monte whole kernel corn, drained. I blended cream of celery soup and 3/4 cup of milk in a saucepan and poured it over the meat mixture in an 8x8 casserole. Next, I added 4 handfuls of Mexican cheese blend, put the tots on next, and added a thin layer of shredded cheese. I topped it with 1/2 tsp. of smoked sweets paprika. 35 minutes at 350, then 20 minutes at 300.Good luck and happy eating
Added a can of corn, sauté mushrooms and a dash of Worcestershire sauce. The fussy eater of the family is asking when we are going to make this again.
This is very good! I made it like the recipe and added a bag of frozen vegis and it was a nice mixture as well as fast and easy!

Ok, I used the recipe as a starting point. I used ground turkey instead of ground beef. I used cheese soup, instead of the soup called for. I put asparagus in the dish, with the ground turkey and onion on top of it. I mixed in salsa with the milk and soup. and I used two cups of shredded mexican cheese blend and a whole bag of Tater Crowns, instead of Tater Tots. But it was good and I would make it again
This is one of my families favorites! My husband hates mushrooms so I have to substitute with cream of chicken soup, tastes amazing!

I did make a few changes. I used 1.5 pounds of ground beef and added a little Worcestershire sauce. I also added in a can of french cut green beans and a can of mushrooms so that I could stretch this into a 9x13 pan, so there would be leftovers for dinner. Added the cheese at the end and put it back in to melt.

I made this dish exactly as specified in the original recipe. I thought it had all the ingredients for a great dish, but I was mildly disappointed with the final results. It was simply missing "something", and was rather bland. In the future I will use this recipe as a base, and modify it once I decide how to give it some pizazz.

family loved it! I tried a few of the suggestions about seasoning the meat, adding vegetables and not putting anything on top of the tater tots so they stay crispy. My family can be picky sometimes to I try to keep with what I think they would like, which is why I also added frenchers onions in-between several levels. I think this is a great recipe even without changes as it gives you options to play with.
I seasoned the meat while it was cooking instead of afterwards and used onion tater tots instead of plain tots. Turned out great!

I have been looking for the original tater tot recipe for quite some time. I only changed as follows: added Worcestershire sauce to taste and mixed the cheese in with the meat mixture. I think this made the “tots” turn out crispier. Thank you for the recipe. Will definitely make again soon!
I liked this as written but preferred it second time with tweeks. 2 cans cream of mushroom
Made per recipe....did not care for it at all.
5 stars because my fussy 4 year old scoffed it. Next time I make it I’ll add Worcestershire sauce for a bit more flavor.

The original recipe appeared on an Ore-Ida Tater Tot box over 40 years ago. It called for 1 lb. of ground beef and a can of undiluted Cream of Celery soup topped with the tater tots. Brown the beef , place in a baking dish, spread the soup on top and add the tater tots. Bake at 400 for 45 min. I've made it for years and only add some chopped onion to the beef, and changed the soup to Golden Mushroom for more flavor. You can easily increase the amount of beef...still tastes delicious and it's EASY .

I doubled this recipe and added garlic when browning the meat. I used two Amy's semi-condensed soup at 14.3 oz and did not add milk. I also used seasoned Tater Tots. It was a hit. I don't usually serve casseroles for family dinner but this was for a family lunch and even the hard to please diners loved it. 
Next time, I might take the advice of others and mix the soup with the meat and put the tater tots on top.

As far as casserole dishes go, this is pretty typical fare. Nothing surprising or exciting, but if you need to get dinner on the table fast and you have these ingredients. It'll fill the bill. I liked it, but wouldn't recommend it for a special dinner event.
Added the whole bag of tater tots and added a can of kernel corn, also a tablespoon of worchestershire sauce and garlic. It's definitely a keeper !!!
I added frozen corn, mushrooms and edamame on top of the layer of meat as I wanted to get in servings of veggies. Turned out great and you could use about any veggies you want. Super good!!

This is a good recipe. After reading some reviews I developed my plan. I sautéed my onion with some finely chopped carrots and celery, then browned my ground beef (about 1 and1/3 lb) along with the vegetables; seasoning that beef with salt, and garlic pepper and a tiny dash of cayenne. I had about 1/2 cup sour cream in the fridge and added that to the soup mixture and mixed it with the ground beef mixture; then threw in some frozen green peas and at least a cup of the cheddar. I let the tater tots thaw after I added them to the top, then sprinkled another 1/2 cup of the cheese over all, before baking. This was gobbled up by adults and little kids. We all agreed that the tots were probably best in the crispy state. So basically shepherds pie with tots instead of mash. Again, the pan was clea
Very very easy to make. I have a picky eater and they requested seconds. Will definitely make again, although I may sauté mushrooms with the onions. Awesome!
I loved it. My family did to. It was easy to make and worth the bite.
Made "as is" and the dish is an immediate family favorite! thanks for the recipe!
Simple but delicious. We are gluten free so had to make my own cream of mushroom soup but all ingredients blended well. Took others suggestion and put green beans on bottom. Would make again.
This was easy and yummy! Will make again! Our new favorite.

Made this because I needed something fairly quick & easy & comforting as the weather turns cooler at night (& not chicken!). After reading other reviews first, I made similar changes to meat while browning it, adding worchestire, minced garlic, garlic powder, pepper, etc for added flavor. I started having second thoughts about this recipe while placing items in the baking dish. My family turned their noses up on it as well based on the appearance. It is basic. It is not even middle of the road acceptable. Squeeze ketchup on it, take a bite & close your eyes & sure you think you're eating a cheese burger & fries but honestly, next time I'll choose to put the energy into firing up the grill for actual cheese burgers (without the mega sodium canned soup!!!).

Made this exactly as written except that I doubled the recipe, which increased the cooking time. We loved this as is, and think that it's delicious without any modifications, it's also a great base recipe so you can tweak it to your own tastes. Next time we want to add a few chopped green chilies to spice it up a bit, mix the soup with the ground beef so it doesn't fall apart when serving. Thanks for a new regular in our comfort food rotation!

Made this was OK I found it needed more flavor in the ground me added some corn and peas needed something else though Maybe some Vielvetta cheese mixed in and some tomato i'll try to again thanks for the recipe
